document.title: Rhode Island Core Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy

95B11336CE844C679467AE942EEC24FD.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, activities in the kindergarten curriculum, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

35FB6685BC3D41B6A18505E6E17991D3.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge.

CCB9A6EC500847F9982178A7CA51DACD.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

860322E80D9B431C82E996D32C062DB5.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

503B8F546E7142A98E846C6AAB56E06A.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

BD4BD93DBAD0415C8B53905FF6F33EB6.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

B6F7DDE119904E7DB531D2E983899C2B.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

16A4A7EAD65F446680DAB9E247D35630.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

A49468BE186242FEAF353CA9A824C097.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

6ECC741CB45747BEACDF2CE087170502.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

58076A89C4A448EFAFA06C99B0341F0D.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

2A21C338DA3A4F9E90964308D3B72AB1.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

94BCDEF1EAD8461B9C8F099B05E83973.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

8F00D996F9BB44ED80E67D8E471645E2.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

E712BC4EA9BF4F63883C722BE92BC2E2.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

5FC6A6FBDF9C4B8BB268165D3628D7B5.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

30818F795CDD43C6BE19F69D009A9F09.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2C1A9AF0383F445194A241B0C82CF164.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.

F6DBDAF141104C9B9375B26E74D2DEA6.description: Form questions that seek additional information, rather than a simple yes/no answer.

8520F1A5426846DBA8FD93DB03FD8D28.description: Demonstrate the ability to produce and expand complete sentences using frequently occurring nouns, pronouns, adjectives, verbs, question words, and prepositions; name and use in context numbers 0–100 (see kindergarten mathematics standards for Counting and Cardinality).

D868F9AA19E843B5B9F7E52D7995A782.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking; retain and further develop language skills learned previously.

171158D89CBC4CBBBAA57E9E186BFC8B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

3EB1EB2136B4448D9555647FED4EF6F0.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

248581E7408E40B6BD4D0BB1A616D829.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

B8139778AEBC42F8AC4B2710F1B4A5D9.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

BB71E86E6E864A82AEFBA85D1B39AEC2.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

5CEAD661B8E747DEBB137100F4EA662E.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

9B138FDFE8FB4E36A205B52A1C415534.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that:
  • Listeners can follow the line of reasoning.
  • The organization, development, vocabulary, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

281F0538ABEE43129422C3193868561D.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

2667E0D367E54657AAA0E3BD3B405F1C.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

77B40988FFF64181813F3C14BB969DA5.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

B925CB382D8A4FB7A8751458C91AA7CB.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

45F06EE519DA44A3B103F409C1200633.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

5DC21F8A6847423E81234EE2D18F464C.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

6A7F30266DAC430A9583B07E9A531087.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

E190EA7DE46B4B319D322FA52D665149.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

AC0A29F073D545B5AFEE87F9A730302B.description: Write or dictate writing routinely for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

2A2563D834F645C79111C7FFEDB69376.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

2E3DDF589B7C4CA6810E3FD1C63CEE5A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, interpretation, reflection, and research.

76FBAAAF6F1E49EFAFA10A073F87E100.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

1059A3C2FEAA4B6B8F60898ED841D987.description: When conducting research, gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

D3E25F519A014173BE6CA0B6E8347DE8.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

81EFCD25374145E1879CEB0796C170D7.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

C72AB281B516486CB3ED19D3B4504D90.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including collaboration with peers.

799E876227104DFF9939778DA2D6EB2C.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

4BEEB4E5E8284744992016C29B2A928A.description: Demonstrate the ability to use vocabulary appropriate for kindergarten.

5443D74893124D77A972A72E403330A8.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

D24D870CDE494287A7BB30E6AD70801E.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

010E65942C3C4E5B90AB2A5E98E91EED.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

F2DE0D536C31421C949887EFAA18549E.description: For poems, use rhyming words to create structure.

F468591F2DD54A6884E245DCE656DC87.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or experience, or several loosely linked events or experiences; sequence the narrative appropriately and provide a reaction to what it describes.

6A16D44151A44F07A98CBA51071399FF.description: Write narratives to develop experiences or events using effective literary techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured sequences.

D735637DF93D4B809839DBC3C3451152.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts that name and supply some information about a topic.

6A01F7F6A4D44F17A1280D32F5F20BEF.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

36F45B21897E487A9A21270FEE16347D.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces that tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is...).

818CA9264D3748F9AA18C4FA66FE5112.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

E804836BD04A45AD9EFB37C8D7F69BFA.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

F80759DD1D104CDD8E064283B9475A1F.description: Independently and proficiently read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts.

0FE48D647A0A49F7A6364062B9B36D23.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, procedures).

E8948C4EC4F144C39911AA15C1F43E13.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

29E18F62F5874BF5B23DDC4920223487.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

AD73DBBD2F854C61AEA228B66159C736.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

26D00F26281549CF9218BEBAFFBF94C2.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

609BCCE964DF4D2C850D87F4AC811A5D.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

EE839D0CBBFE48F789A4180F8C5C870C.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in the text.

866FFB78752B45929B2F71DABEC96AC5.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

601411C427AC40E08563F6B0A3F00283.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

3550DCBBC561480D8433C3E593C02884.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of a text relate to each other and the whole.

26CF3A2DE2E2461DBA1F637BFE680BB9.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

4D5B0769C5B747DF91E4B6777FDD1B68.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

169F37E683C54FBDA4DC595074FDF501.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

83C06032542241A0B699EAACE5384388.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

497F13F806A0447387FDDB1AC621B753.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

0FE8CF44D6044833AA3749B81F3683FC.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

76ACCBD739B2424999CB5DA19135CB90.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

D1D799BF2C29473BB487EBF76CECD780.description: Read closely to determine what a text states explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from a text.

1B7499AC51D449289D3972DA99579D0D.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

A46203F43D8841EBB416AD90B7DDD6C6.description: Independently and proficiently read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts.

C8EA659868DF43679192205ABAF99992.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

1EA2DCD375B04559BACBBFE87644BE5A.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

0E8A3922ABCB49E485EA77D2399CACD4.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

DA4E70EDC94F460AB6E3F3468C612A59.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

192EB27CA4B541189334C934313D79AD.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

EAEEFAEB21004E56AA4428A4A0FBC7E7.description: With prompting and support, explain that reading the cover or title page is how to find out who created a book; name the author and illustrator of a book and define the role of each in telling the story.

B6CD1E79E708400788C45412332C0637.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

213C417787BE45B28B22464843C5C8C3.description: Recognize common types of texts and characteristics of their structure (e.g., story elements in books; rhyme, rhythm, and repetition in poems).

184BA9097D4E4F0D8766C9DBB3D327A5.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of a text relate to each other and the whole.

5965807BF3B147C88B135D71CA6E01C4.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text. (See kindergarten Language Standards 4–6 on applying knowledge of vocabulary to reading.)

0508D6D77ABE43EA9AC5E850D0A71695.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

107C054DEC3D4F37862E329C05994987.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

29085D676AC44B869E1244C6D053F1AD.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

6F319AC0D43046E28BC23EE81BA3D9C0.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

7203EF5F010F443A9CB1A5D39C64942F.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

AB6D5099A822424895F4AC81321DA641.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

4886356402684BEFB7CA499E44777923.description: Read closely to determine what a text states explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from a text.

9EB71B747AC64FF9A4D992A7C53CB9DE.description: Read early-emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

500E00401FDC4ABBBFEEB602AE560ACD.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

C089F2F32573400EA2166C64627925E9.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

8EA88264CAED492888002705C7A30042.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

7FAAB4E191CE428A9624B61CF4622B64.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

4EE269FE94D14587B5B84A9465C7A692.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

1CD91DDCDE9E4BE6BC89230BA28031BC.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.

4F76DC3F512C4D91972685471935129B.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

FC8F687EB3AB4502833128B197397C3A.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

3CA7B311034D496C8E365B9F96F14027.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

5019B9A8531A4E539F147B83153AED84.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

CB3433236C2940EE9525C97E7E9BE1B2.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

C9FDA85D1B3E47D391DD3D4680292157.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

795ED4247A72421EA66D54A9BA096135.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

E03DEF90CEC14168925D46323074F832.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
